Description: Rim fragment of large pottery stirrup krater. On top of flat rim, meander band, on outside dots; on neck, guilloche with glazed area beside handle to right. Red clay with mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Almost certainly from the same vase as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum 9478.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 213, no. 27)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 117, pl. XXXVI, no. 330.3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.307)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4701 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
